results.title: Laugh slap howl
results.creator_credit: Cath Murphy and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: An animated film about an old lady and her dog living together in a block of flats who are disturbed by some unearthly noises coming from the hallway. Both scared, they proceed down the hall to a darkly lit room, the source of the strange noises.

results.title: Laugh lines: a profile of Kaj Pindal
results.creator_credit: Franco Battista, Zina Heczko, David Verrall, Derek Lamb, ONF | NFB and Walt Disney
results.brief_description: Laugh Lines is a film portrait of animator Kaj Pindal. He is seen at work creating zany cartoon characters, teaching students of animation, and at home enjoying another of his creations, a full-size streetcar that tours his backyard. The laughter in Pindal’s life is evident in this delightful film biography. Photographed by Raymond Dumas and Richard Mores. Edited by Ian Rankin. Music by Betty Lazebnik. (Awards: Cracow; San Antonio.)

results.title: Latitude, longitude and time zones
results.brief_description: Shows how parallels of latitude and meridians of longitude can be used to determine the position of a place anywhere on the earth’s surface. Explains how the time zones were established. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description: Shows how parallels of latitude and meridians of longitude can be used to determine the position of a place anywhere on the earth’s surface. Explains how the time zones were established. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Latitude and longitude
results.brief_description: By use of animation and models, the world is made to open up and a transparent globe is used to explain angles in the interior of the earth. The subject is related to fixing the position of a ship at sea. Latitude and longitude are explained.

results.title: Latin America: an introduction
results.brief_description: Introduces the nations which comprise Latin America. Presents the common bonds of history, traditions, religion, customs, and languages that the people share as key ideas in understanding the meaning of Latin America. Includes views of a fiesta.

results.title: Lathe: work between centres
results.creator_credit: Helmut Engelhardt, Joe Hayward and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Machine Operations Metal Work”.
Finding centres of end of stock, marking, and aligning between centres. Turning one face for reference point, rough cutting, and using automatic longitudinal feed. Knurling tools and techniques, taper turning from large to small diameter using the set-over tail-stock method.

results.title: Late News
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Office of Intellectual Disability Services. Early Intervention Resource Unit
results.brief_description: Highlights the impact a late diagnosis of a developmental delay has on parents and the family. The program illustrates how early intervention services provide information, support, resources and individual programs in order to promote a child’s development.

results.title: Late for dinner: was Dawn right?
results.creator_credit: Gary Bergland and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Dawn, an Afro-American aged around eight, and her two friends have gone to play in the park. Dawn’s mother has told her it is very important she is home on time for dinner and stresses for her not to be late. However on her way home, Dawn collides with a woman running to catch a bus and in the confusion the woman drops a five-dollar bill. The woman boards her bus before Dawn can return the money. Dawn attempts to catch up with the bus but fails and consequently she arrives home late for dinner with money that doesn’t belong to her. Before she can explain, her mother begins to scold her - “Why are you late?” Helps children see that conflicting feelings are both common and normal. Set in the tenament area of Chicago. Part of the “How does it make you feel?” series. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Latcho drom : safe journey = Latcho drom : bonne route
results.creator_credit: Tony Gatlif, Michele Ray-Gavras and K G Productions
results.brief_description: A masterpiece by Tony Gatlif is a “docu-musical” which explores the rich cultural, social heritage of the world’s Gypsies. The program is a political statement about the persecution suffered by Gypsies but is presented as a celebration of their music, dance and song from the around the globe. Singers, dancers and musicians from India, Egypt, Turkey, Romania, Hungary, Slovakia, France and Spain are featured. This is an energetic, powerful, joyous experience.
